box.text:
Questions

Answer the following questions by selecting true or false.

You may need to refer back to the information presented in this topic to help you with your answers.

question.text:
Question 7

If property related documents are not available at the time of inspection, any property inspection report or appraisal report provided must be made subject to reviewing those documents which may indicate material matters such as encumbrances, and or compliance related issues.

question.text:
Question 8

Building line restrictions and building setback requirements are always recorded on the certificate of title.

question.text:
Question 9

Rights and responsibilities in relation to shared driveways and access are the same for properties held as a cross-lease, strata title, right of way easement or as an access lot.

fb.text: Try the next question

Not quite.

You selected some but not all of the correct options. Please try again.

question.text:
Question 10

Protected trees are usually noted on planning maps or are listed in the appendices of a district plan. They may also appear on a LIM report.

fb.text: Try the next question

Not quite.

You selected some but not all of the correct options. Please try again.

question.text:
Question 11

In subsidence prone areas, district plans will always contain specific details showing when additional work is required for the foundations of buildings.

fb.text: Try the next question

Not quite.

You selected some but not all of the correct options. Please try again.

question.text:
Question 12

Wastewater pipes have a lifespan of about 80 years, and are designed to withstand normal tree root and traffic loadings. Age is often a factor when pipes become blocked or seep, so it is important to be wary of properties with old pipes.

fb.text: Try the next question

Not quite.

You selected some but not all of the correct options. Please try again.

question.text:
Question 13

District plans will always show any susceptibility of land to flooding.

fb.text: Try the next question

Not quite.

You selected some but not all of the correct options. Please try again.

question.text:
Question 14

Building Code requirements for floor levels are the absolute minimum. In some areas the required minimum floor levels are established for all buildings by the authority and are specified in the district plan. This occurs in areas deemed to be high risk or hazard zones.

fb.text: Try the next question

question.text:
Question 15

The number of bedrooms marketed when offering a residential property must reflect bedroom requirements as prescribed by the Housing Improvement Regulations 1947.

fb.text: Try the next question

Not quite.

You selected some but not all of the correct options. Please try again.

question.text:
Question 16

The following provides a description of interior signs of dampness that should signal warning signs to licensees.
- Signs of dampness around doors and window-sills, ceilings, architraves and enclosed areas such as cupboards and wardrobes. With timber joinery, obvious signs include damp patches, dark stains (especially on unpainted surfaces), deterioration of paintwork, and the growth of mould.
- At floor level, swelling of fibreboard skirting boards, or damp areas of carpet or other flooring material, especially at the corners and edges of rooms. Vinyl and similar types of flooring will sometimes start to lift or bubble when left damp over an extended period.

fb.text: Try the next question

You selected some but not all of the correct options. Please try again.

question.text:
Question 17

Local authority loans provided for insulation and / or clean heating do not ‘run with land’, the party who has taken out the loan is the only accountable party.

fb.text: Try the next question

Not quite.

You selected some but not all of the correct options. Please try again.

question.text:
Question 18

Decks, platforms, bridges, boardwalks etc. from which it is not possible to fall more than 1.5 metres do not require a building consent under Schedule 1 of the Building Act 2004. Their construction must, however, comply with the Building Code to ensure they are safe for people to use.

fb.text: Try the next question

Not quite.

You selected some but not all of the correct options. Please try again.

question.text:
Question 19

Licensees should provide advice that any pool which is non-complying should be emptied until the necessary remedial work can be carried out.

fb.text: Try the next question

Not quite.

You selected some but not all of the correct options. Please try again.

question.text:
Question 20

Any accessory building that has the potential to be self-contained (with its own kitchen and laundry facilities) constitutes a minor dwelling. A legal attached or detached minor dwelling can be let to tenants, but requires resource consent as well as building consent. A minor dwelling on a property also affects the way the rates are calculated.
